questions.question: What is a managed switch?
questions.explanation: Managed: configuration capability. Features: VLAN, QoS, monitoring. Interface: web, CLI, SNMP. Benefit: advanced control. Cost: higher. Importance: enterprise use.

questions.question: What is an unmanaged switch?
questions.explanation: Unmanaged: no configuration. Plug: play device. Features: basic forwarding only. Cost: low. Limitation: no advanced features. Usage: small networks. Importance: simplicity.

questions.question: What is a multilayer switch?
questions.explanation: Switch: operates layers 2 and 3. Feature: routing capability. Benefit: performance. Speed: faster than routers. Deployment: core networks. Importance: advanced switching.

questions.question: What is a PoE (Power over Ethernet)?
questions.explanation: PoE: power in Ethernet cable. Devices: APs, cameras, phones. Standards: 802.3af, 802.3at. Benefit: single cable. Limitation: power limited. Importance: simplification.

questions.question: What is a network proxy?
questions.explanation: Proxy: acts on behalf. Function: forwards requests, caches. Types: forward, reverse. Benefit: security, performance, caching. Protocol: HTTP, SOCKS. Importance: enterprise use.

questions.question: What is a load balancer?
questions.explanation: Balancer: distributes requests. Purpose: scale, availability. Methods: round-robin, least connections. Layer: 4 (L4) or 7 (L7). Deployment: servers. Importance: scalability.

questions.question: What is a VLAN?
questions.explanation: VLAN: logical network segment. Purpose: organization, security. Tagging: 802.1Q. Benefit: broadcast isolation. Implementation: switch-based. Importance: network segmentation.

questions.question: What is a trunk port?
questions.explanation: Trunk: carries VLAN traffic. Tagging: 802.1Q frames. Purpose: switch-to-switch. Alternative: access port (single VLAN). Configuration: required. Importance: VLAN deployment.

questions.question: What is an access port?
questions.explanation: Port: connected to single VLAN. Function: untagged frames. Devices: end-user computers. Configuration: simple. Alternative: trunk port. Importance: endpoint connection.

questions.question: What is a DMZ (Demilitarized Zone)?
questions.explanation: DMZ: between internal, external. Purpose: server isolation. Servers: web, email, DNS. Security: multiple firewalls. Protection: from internet. Importance: security architecture.
